speaker: Doctor
text: Can you describe the onset of these symptoms? Are they sudden or gradual?

speaker: Patient
text: "I actually noticed it started a few weeks ago, but it's been getting progressively worse. At first, I thought it was just fatigue, but when I started experiencing it more frequently, I realized it was affecting my daily activities, like brushing my hair and even just walking up the stairs."

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any double vision when looking to the left or right? How about difficulty with fine motor tasks involving your hands?

speaker: Patient
text: "It's pretty much always there, actually. It's just that it's more noticeable when I'm looking at things side by side, like when I'm trying to read or watch TV. And yeah, my hands do feel a bit clumsy, especially when I'm trying to do something that requires a lot of precision, like drawing or typing."

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any double vision when looking upwards or downwards? And do you feel unsteady when standing up from a seated position?

speaker: Patient
text: "To be honest, it's pretty much the same - both horizontally and vertically. I can see two images of the same thing, but they're not quite aligned, even when I'm looking straight ahead. As for standing up, I do feel a bit off balance, like my body is a bit wobbly. I have to grab onto something for support, even when I'm standing still."

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent infections or illnesses? REQUEST TEST: Blood tests for inflammation and nerve function.

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: Blood Tests: Inflammation - Elevated (Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate: 40 mm/hr, C-Reactive Protein: 25 mg/L), Nerve Function - Normal

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any improvement or worsening of symptoms after resting or during the day? DIAGNOSIS READY: Myasthenia Gravis pending test results.
